_comment: This example demonstrates various input types in a single component
name: multi_input_demo
title: Multi-Input Demo
description: Demonstrates all common input types: Table, Column, String, Number, Boolean, Selection, Range

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: Table - represents upstream workflow connection
inputs.name: input_table
inputs.title: Input table

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: Column - allows selecting a column from the parent table
inputs.name: id_column
inputs.title: ID column
inputs.helper: Column inputs filter based on dataType array

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: String - single-line text input
inputs.name: label
inputs.title: Label
inputs.helper: String inputs can have placeholders and defaults

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: String with multiline mode - textarea
inputs.name: description
inputs.title: Description
inputs.helper: Use mode: multiline for longer text inputs

inputs.name: threshold
inputs.title: Threshold
inputs.helper: Number inputs can specify min/max ranges

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: Number with slider mode
inputs.name: radius
inputs.title: Radius (km)
inputs.helper: Use mode: slider for visual range selection

inputs.name: include_nulls
inputs.title: Include null values
inputs.description: Whether to include rows with null values

inputs._comment: INPUT TYPE: Selection with multiple mode
inputs.name: categories
inputs.title: Categories
inputs.helper: Use mode: multiple for multi-select dropdowns

inputs._comment: ADVANCED OPTION: Groups less common inputs under 'Advanced'
inputs.name: advanced_setting
inputs.title: Advanced setting
inputs.helper: Use advanced: true to collapse input under 'Advanced options'

_implementation_note: This example shows metadata only. For SQL implementation, follow patterns in 01-minimal-component/fullrun.sql and dryrun.sql. All input values become variables you can use in SQL.

_usage_in_sql._comment: How these inputs are accessed in fullrun.sql/dryrun.sql:
_usage_in_sql.input_table: String containing table FQN or session name
_usage_in_sql.label: String value
_usage_in_sql.advanced_setting: String or NULL if not provided (optional)
